intro: Astracantha cesarensis, commonly known as the Cesarensis thistle, is a species of flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in grassland and rocky habitats. The plant is characterized by its spiny, spherical stems and yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. It has adapted to arid conditions with a deep root system and waxy leaves to reduce water loss. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
